messages: 99a3bfa1a9430e7df6358b5f3e9e1e17 (15:52): othermaciej_, oh, hello :)
99a3bfa1a9430e7df6358b5f3e9e1e17 (15:52): so... what devil was talked about?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:54): 99a3bfa1a9430e7df6358b5f3e9e1e17, they were discussing On2's VP3 patent licensing issues in relation to implementing Theora
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:55): and whether it covers independent reimplementations
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:56): it's not clear whether it only covers derivatives of the Xiph implementation, or any implementation
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:57): 99a3bfa1a9430e7df6358b5f3e9e1e17, discussion started around here http://krijnhoetmer.nl/irc-logs/whatwg/20090703#l-728
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:57): or maybe slightly before that

99a3bfa1a9430e7df6358b5f3e9e1e17 (15:58): from what I know it should cover independent reimplementaton as the deal with On2 was done in that spirit. One can see current Theora as a non-VP3 related implementation, given it has been rewritten from scratch
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:59): 99a3bfa1a9430e7df6358b5f3e9e1e17, it would be nice to get some official clarification on the issue, preferably from On2 themselves
99a3bfa1a9430e7df6358b5f3e9e1e17 (15:59): I'll forward this
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:00): 99a3bfa1a9430e7df6358b5f3e9e1e17: is it a known problem that Cortado acts weird if there are two instances on one page in IE?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:00): 99a3bfa1a9430e7df6358b5f3e9e1e17: also, what's the difference between the Wikipedia and Xiph Cortado code bases?
99a3bfa1a9430e7df6358b5f3e9e1e17 (16:01): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, no, didn't hear about that issue before
99a3bfa1a9430e7df6358b5f3e9e1e17 (16:01): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, development moved to Xiph.org Git
99a3bfa1a9430e7df6358b5f3e9e1e17 (16:01): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, we're trying to set up a proper project page
99a3bfa1a9430e7df6358b5f3e9e1e17 (16:02): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, currently the Xiph.org version features some decoder fixes over the Wikimedia one
e2633ed61085592add6e058692dfff2f (16:02): if it's a problem caused by two applets onthe page it sounds more like a jvm issue
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:03): I'll try to test it some more
e2633ed61085592add6e058692dfff2f (16:05): I've used cortado a bit and it's worked well for me - but only one per page. I'll try two as well.

99a3bfa1a9430e7df6358b5f3e9e1e17 (16:08): mkay, it seems like any spec-compliant Theora product is derived from the original VP3 codebase simply because the spec was written from scratch with the VP3 source-code as input
99a3bfa1a9430e7df6358b5f3e9e1e17 (16:09): there were zero pages of specification when the VP3/Theora deal was done
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:09): hmm. an implementation of the spec isn't a derivate work of the spec necessarily, is it?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:10): I thought the write-implementation-from-spec-written-from-implementation approach was often used as a way to *avoid* being considered a derivative
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:10): like in http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clean_room_design
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:10): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: yes
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:10): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: though that's cleaning copyright derivation
99a3bfa1a9430e7df6358b5f3e9e1e17 (16:12): I think nobody here is lawyer enough to settle that question. The only reliable source would be the actual agreement.
99a3bfa1a9430e7df6358b5f3e9e1e17 (16:12): I'll forward this request
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:14): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Is there any other form of derivation that would be relevant?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:14): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: the kind of derivation that the On2 promise means
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:16): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Could that kind be anything other than copyright derivation?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:16): I suppose I don't actually care about the answer, and probably nobody knows enough to answer it anyway
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:17): s/nobody/nobody here/
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:19): Huh, #location has irrelevant tests linked
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:20): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: I think it's better if I don't try to guess what someone else's legalese means
